definition: place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point
to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish

sentences.english: He punished in accordance with the law, known as the "generation of Xingming phase."
sentences.chinese: 他依法懲處，被稱爲“一代刑名之相”。

sentences.english: The students will be severely punished if they break school regulations.
sentences.chinese: 一旦違反校紀，就將受到嚴厲懲處。

sentences.english: In some ways I agree with those who want stricter punishments.
sentences.chinese: 我在某些方面同意那些從嚴懲處的人的意見。

sentences.english: Literary inquisition in the Qing Dynasty is known as its large number, its large scale, and its great cruelty.
sentences.chinese: 清代文字獄以次數多，規模大，懲處之殘酷著稱於世。

sentences.english: She avenged her mother's death upon the murderer.
sentences.chinese: 她懲處了兇手，爲母親報了仇。

sentences.english: Literary inquisition of the Qing Dynasty is known for its large number, large scale, and cruelty.
sentences.chinese: 清代文字獄以次數多，規模大，懲處之殘酷著稱於世。

sentences.english: Finally, proposes four measures to punish the offering bribes.
sentences.chinese: 最後提出了加大懲處行賄罪的四個手段。

sentences.english: The nurse involved has been suspended and the head of the hospital reprimanded.
sentences.chinese: 涉案的護士已遭停職處分，醫院的院長也受到懲處。

sentences.english: The courts bear down (hard) on drug-pushers.
But as Rosenkranz insisted on his demand, the king had him arrested and properly punished.
sentences.chinese: 國王於是下令把他拘捕，依法懲處。

sentences.english: Return to FuJun division, Yin Dou hope to punish adm. yi sun-sin light sea king.
sentences.chinese: 回到撫軍司後，尹鬥壽希望光海君能懲處李舜臣。

sentences.english: Discipline my coworker who is out of line.
Law courts must deal with lawbreakers.
sentences.chinese: 法院必須懲處違法分子。

sentences.english: Anyone who tried to keep them as pets faced punishment, even death.
sentences.chinese: 平民畜養該犬將受到懲處，甚至死刑。

sentences.english: The severe punishment was meted out to the unruly hooligan.
sentences.chinese: 對那個囂張的流氓已給予嚴厲懲處。

sentences.english: The ringleaders were marked out for punishment.
sentences.chinese: 這些壞頭目註定要受到懲處。

definition: lack of discipline/to break a rule/to violate discipline/to breach a principle
to hold accountable/to blame/to censure/to apportion blame
bring order out of chaos/set to rights things which have been thrown into disorder
to turn a blind eye to
to take action/to adopt policies/to move on some issue
